Problem was occurring when we tried to get a welcome
message before the message file parsing has completed.

title: Add alreadyWelcomed and alreadyReturned messages
message:
Add alreadyWelcomed and alreadyReturned messages

Add handling of unexpected presentation of riders to
the JSON message repertoire, i.e.,
  alreadyWelcomed messages are identical to welcome messages, but
      will be used when the rider is already on the manifest, i.e.
      they presented their NFC tag already.

  alreadyReturned messages are similar to return messages, but with
      the "isLast" boolean replaced with a "dejaVu" boolean. These
      messages will be used when the rider is not found on the
      manifest. dejaVu will be "t" if the rider was removed from
      the manifest recently.

  Also, I applied several Android Studio lint recommendations and
      a few other minor cleanups.

  Finally, I updated to Android Studio 2.3.1 and new gradle/plugin.

title: Added validation to the code that extracts the name from the rider ID
message:
Added validation to the code that extracts the name from the rider ID
and safely handled all cases that relied on it.
Also warn the user if a manually entered ID does not match the expected format.

title: Added support for reading JSON files.
message:
Added support for reading JSON files.
The parser will try loading the JSON file first and then fall back to the old-school text file if the JSON file doesn't exist.
The downloader will treat the URL as a JSON file if it ends with .json. This is temporary until we phase out the text file.
